### Problem

Treesitter folding fails due to invalid foldupdate_range values. The issue is difficult to reproduce, and I was only able to retrigger (invalid top stacktrace) via undofile.

### Steps to reproduce

Very difficult to reproduce since I had to manually set undofile in undodir.

-- Run this file as `nvim --clean -u minimal.lua`
```

local repro_dir = vim.fs.joinpath(vim.uv.cwd(), ".repro")
vim.env.XDG_CONFIG_HOME = repro_dir .. "/config"
vim.env.XDG_DATA_HOME = repro_dir .. "/share"
vim.env.XDG_STATE_HOME = repro_dir .. "/state"
vim.env.XDG_CACHE_HOME = repro_dir .. "/cache"

vim.opt.packpath:prepend(repro_dir .. "/share/nvim/site")

vim.pack.add({
  {
    src = "https://github.com/nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter",
    version = "main",
  },
})

require("nvim-treesitter").setup({
  install_dir = repro_dir .. "share/nvim/site/",
})

require("nvim-treesitter").install("bash")
vim.treesitter.start(nil, "bash")

local o = vim.o
o.undofile = true
o.undodir = vim.env.XDG_STATE_HOME .. "/nvim/undo"
o.foldenable = true
o.foldmethod = "expr"
o.foldexpr = "v:lua.vim.treesitter.foldexpr()"
```

### Expected behavior

No crash

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

v0.12.0-dev-a26cdcb

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no

### Operating system/version

Ubuntu 24.04.3 LTS

### Terminal name/version

Gnome terminal

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

repo
